summary.overall_findings: Emerson Electric's public disclosures show evidence of both operational practices and policy-level commitments across its responsible AI framework. Operational practices include a sustainability report documenting commitments to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion, alongside definitive proxy statements highlighting mechanisms for responsible technology oversight. These materials address 6 of 7 evaluated responsible AI pillars, with policy-level evidence spanning transparency, explainability, oversight, and privacy, including disclosures describing the use of automated systems like reCAPTCHA and outlining data disclosure practices to third parties. No qualifying public evidence was found for external accountability. The assessment draws on 17 publicly available sources.
